title: Oregon Caves National Monument & Preserve: Mammals
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Mammals                 Mammals       Inside the Cave At least eight of the fifteen bat species found in Oregon occur within the boundaries of Oregon Caves National Monument. Most bats seen by the main trail are Townsend big-eared bats, Yuma bats, long-eared myotis bats, silvered-haired bat, big brown bat, Western small-footed bat, California myotis, little brown myotis, and fringed myotis. Outside the Cave Squirrels, chipmunks, and fox are quite common. Black bears, cougars, and Mountain beaver are a bit more secretive.
